_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN-EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Facility: Trotter Terminal

City: Ord

Contact: Mike Fischer

Phone: 308-728-7722



1.Facility Policy.



     The owners, management, and employees of Trotter Terminal are commited to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to persons and the environment.



2.Facility Information.



     Trotter Terminal is a small independent retail facility for plant food and crop protection chemicals.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct applicationas fertilizer for crop production.



3.Accidental Release Prevention Program.

     

     This facility is in compliance with the provisions of "Saftey Requirments for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia k-41.1", published by The American Standards Institute in,.(ANSI) and the standards of the U>S> Occupational Safety and Health Adminstrtion (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.111,"Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form, see Section 8.3(b).



4. Five-year Accident History.

      There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the last five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor, to our knowledge, has THERE BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off-site deaths, injuies, evacuation, property damage, or environmental damage.



5.

   The Facility has;

     a. A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.38;

     b. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know informationas required under SARA Title III (EPCRA)



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety.



   Safety Improvements are an on-going process at this facility. Periodic evaluations are p

erformed to assess the maintenance and safe conditions of our equipment. There no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations at this time.



7.For further information contact; Mike Fischer at 308-728-7722
